title: Foreign Policy
description: Foreign policy refers to a government's strategy and decisions in dealing with other nations. It encompasses a wide range of activities, including diplomacy, trade negotiations, military alliances, and international aid. Foreign policy aims to protect and promote a nation's interests, security, and values on the global stage. It is influenced by factors such as geopolitical dynamics, economic needs, historical relationships, and domestic political pressures. Key aspects include managing international conflicts, fostering economic cooperation, and addressing global challenges such as climate change, terrorism, and human rights.
